message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.COMM, cs.DC 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the Tactile Internet, which is a next-generation wireless network service, and investigates resource allocation in a heterogeneous network. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper deals with end-to-end delay and formulates an optimization problem to minimize the total cost function subject to guaranteeing E2E delay of each user. 
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper considers network function virtualization (NFV) and joint radio resource allocation (R-RA) and NFV resource allocation (NFV-RA) in a heterogeneous network. 
4. cs.COMM (Communications and Networking) - The paper deals with resource allocation in a wireless network and considers queuing delays, transmission delays, and delays resulting from virtual network function (VNF) execution. 
5. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper proposes alternative search method (ASM), successive convex approximation (SCA), and heuristic algorithms to solve the highly non-convex optimization problem.
